title: Sunderland striker Jermain Defoe set to be named in England squad for Germany and Lithuania fixtures
text:

Gareth Southgate has named Jermain Defoe in his England squad for the upcoming fixtures against Germany and Lithuania. 
The 34-year-old striker's last appearance in a Three Lions shirt came in a 2-0 friendly defeat by Chile at Wembley in November 2013. 
But his fine form for Premier League strugglers Sunderland this season, coupled with injuries to Wayne Rooney, Harry Kane and Daniel Sturridge, has seen him earn a recall to the squad. 
Defoe, who has scored 14 goals in 27 top-flight appearances this season, made his England debut in March 2004 and has scored 19 times in 55 appearances for his country. 
England travel to Dortmund for a friendly against Germany on March 22 before a World Cup qualifier against Lithuania at Wembley four days later. Defoe hasn't played for England since a friendly against Chile in November 2013 (Photo: The FA via Getty) 
In December Defoe raised doubts about whether he would ever receive an international recall. 
"I almost feel like it doesn’t matter what I do, even if I get the Golden Boot I still don’t think I’d get called up," he said. 
But new boss Southgate, who is preparing for his fifth and sixth games in charge of England, has proved the veteran striker wrong by including him in a first squad since 2014. 
Jake Livermore of Hull and Southampton duo James Ward-Prowse and Nathan Redmond have also been called up. 
Squad: Forster, Hart, Heaton; Bertrand, Cahill, Clyne, Jones, Keane, Shaw, Smalling, Walker, Stones; Alli, Antonio, Barkley, Dier, Lallana, Lingard, Livermore, Oxlade-Chamberlain, Redmond, Sterling, Ward-Prowse; Defoe, Rashford, Vardy Like us on Facebook
